page.title: 13FARMING AND EMPLOYMENT.
page.content: A major{source of employment}in this semi_rural Survey area are the Farms. The other major source of employment exists in the service sector: shops, banks, pubs and in recreation: livery stables and groundsmen. Industry is confined to the sewage works and a few small businesses, one of note makes paper goods. Approximately fifty per cent of the are is given over to farmland which survives despite pressure from housing, recreation and, of course, the{motorway.}The farms, big and small, are mainly arable as very few herds of livestock were seen. Fields were large yet hedges seem well preserved. The major, more mechanised concerns are{Dairyhouse Farm}and {Houghgreen Farm.}There are many, smaller, family holdings boasting ducks, rabbits and goats. Of note is {Ashley Hall Farm}of Tatton Estates.
